originalTitle: More than 160 churchgoers kidnapped in twin Nigeria attacks - clergy
title: Sad News from Nigeria: People Taken from Church
content:
Hello, Little Reporters!

Hi everyone! Your friendly African news reporter is here. Today, we have some news from a country called Nigeria. Nigeria is a very big country in Africa, just like where many of you live! It has lots of people and many beautiful places. We want to tell you about something that happened there, and we will explain it very simply. Sometimes, sad things happen, but it's important to understand them and always remember to be kind and hopeful. Did you know? Nigeria is the country with the most people in all of Africa! It has over 200 million people! That's a lot of friends and families living there.

Sad News from a Sunday Morning

Last Sunday, something sad happened in a place in Nigeria called Kurmin Wali. Many families were at church. A church is a special building where people go to pray and sing and be together. It's like a community gathering place for many people. It was a normal Sunday morning, just like when you might go to school or play with your friends. But then, some bad people came. We call these bad people a "gang." A gang is a group of people who do wrong things. They went into two churches. This was very scary for everyone there. These bad people took many grown-ups and some children away from the churches. This is called being "kidnapped." Did you know? Sunday is a special day for many people around the world. It's often a day for rest, family, and going to church or other places of worship!

People Are Missing

More than 160 people were taken away. That's a very big number! Imagine if all the grown-ups from your school and many children suddenly went missing. Their families and friends are very, very sad and worried. They miss their loved ones very much. It's like when your toy goes missing, but much, much sadder because it's a person. When someone is kidnapped, it means they are taken by force. They cannot go home to their families. This is a very wrong thing to do. Everyone deserves to be safe and with their family. We hope and pray that these people will come back home very soon. Did you know? In Nigeria, people speak many different languages! English is one of the main languages, but there are also languages like Hausa, Yoruba, and Igbo.

What Are People Doing to Help?

Good people in Nigeria are working very hard to find everyone who was taken. The police are helping. Police are special helpers who keep us safe and try to catch bad people. They are looking for the missing people and the bad people who took them. Many other people are also praying for their safe return. When sad things happen, it's good to know that there are always people who want to help. The community, which means all the people living together, is thinking about the families. They are giving them comfort and support. This shows how strong people can be when they work together. Did you know? When communities help each other, it's called "solidarity." It means standing together and supporting one another, especially when things are tough.

Why Do Bad Things Happen?

Sometimes, bad people do bad things because they want money or they want to cause trouble. It's never okay, and it's never the fault of the good people who are taken. It's very important to remember that most people in the world are good and kind. These bad people are a small group. We should always try to be kind and good to everyone we meet. When we are kind, we make the world a better place. Even if we are far away, we can send good thoughts and wishes to the people in Nigeria. Did you know? Most churches, mosques, temples, and other places of worship are safe and peaceful places where people go to feel close to God and their community.

Fun Facts About Nigeria!

Nigeria is known for its amazing music, delicious food, and wonderful stories. Many talented artists and musicians come from Nigeria. It's a country full of life and joy. They have beautiful markets where people sell fruits, vegetables, and colorful clothes. Imagine a country where you can see big cities, huge forests, and even lovely beaches! That's Nigeria! It's a land of many wonders and amazing animals too. There are so many good things about Nigeria that we love to celebrate. Did you know? Nigeria is sometimes called the "Giant of Africa" because it's so big and has so many people!

Wishing for Everyone to Come Home

We are sending all our good wishes and hope to the people who are missing. We hope that the police and all the helpers will find them quickly. We hope that all the grown-ups and children will be able to go back to their homes and families soon. Their families are waiting for them with open arms. It's important to always remember that even when sad things happen, there is always hope. People helping each other, praying, and working hard can make a big difference. Let's keep Nigeria in our thoughts. Did you know? Many children in Africa love to play soccer (or football)! It's one of the most popular sports there, just like in many other parts of the world.

Be Kind and Stay Safe

So, remember, even when news is sad, it's important to understand it simply. We learn that bad things can happen, but also that there are always good people trying to help. Always listen to your grown-ups, stay safe, and be kind to everyone around you. Your kindness can make someone's day a little brighter. We will keep you updated if there is more news about the people coming home. Thank you for listening, little reporters!
summary: In Nigeria, bad people took many grown-ups and children from two churches, and now everyone is hoping and working hard to bring them home safely.
whyMatters: This is important because everyone deserves to be safe, especially in special places like churches, and we all hope the missing people can go back to their families soon.

originalTitle: Norway PM: Trump ‘preoccupied’ with Nobel Peace Prize on Greenland texts
title: Big News! Leaders, Texts, and a Snowy Island!
content:
Jambo, my amazing young news explorers from Africa! It's your friendly reporter here, ready to share some exciting news from far, far away across the big oceans. Today, we're talking about important people, funny messages, and a giant island made of ice! Let's dive in!

Hello, My Little News Explorers!

Hello everyone! I'm so happy to be sharing news with you today. We're going to learn about leaders from other parts of the world. Even though this news is from very far away, it helps us understand how grown-ups who lead countries talk to each other. It's a little bit like how your teachers or parents talk about important things, but on a much, much bigger scale! We'll keep it super simple, so grab a seat and let's go on an adventure to learn about a snowy place and a very special prize.

Meet Our Story's Big Leaders!

In our story today, we have two very important people. First, there's **Mr. Jonas Gahr Store**. He is the **Prime Minister** of a country called **Norway**. Imagine your school principal, but for a whole country! That's what a Prime Minister is. Norway is a beautiful country far up north, where it gets very cold and snowy. Then, we have **Mr. Donald Trump**. He used to be the **President** of a very, very big country called **America**. A President is also like a principal for a country, guiding it and making big decisions. Both of these men are very important leaders.

What is a "Text Message Exchange"?

Do you know what a text message is? It's when you send little written notes on a phone! Sometimes, grown-ups send texts back and forth, right? That's what we call a "text message exchange." It's like having a quick chat, but by typing words. Well, guess what? Big leaders like Prime Ministers and Presidents sometimes send text messages to each other too! These messages can be about very important things, like what's happening in their countries or other places in the world. But sometimes, they talk about other things too. And that's where our story gets interesting!

Talking About a Snowy Island: Greenland!

Now, let's talk about a place called **Greenland**. Can you imagine a huge island, bigger than many countries? Greenland is that island! It's mostly covered in ice and snow, and it's very, very cold there. It has beautiful glaciers and icy mountains. *Did you know?* Greenland is the largest island in the whole world! It's so, so big! It doesn't belong to Norway or America, but to another country called Denmark. It's a very unique and special place. Sometimes, leaders talk about places like Greenland because they are important for the world.

The Special Award: Nobel Peace Prize!

Okay, get ready for something truly special! Have you ever heard of the **Nobel Peace Prize**? It's a super important award. It's like getting the biggest, most shiny gold medal for being kind, making friends, and trying to stop fighting in the world. People who work very hard to bring peace to our planet, to make everyone live happily together, can win this amazing prize. *Did you know?* The Nobel Peace Prize is named after a man called Alfred Nobel. He wanted people to celebrate those who make the world a better place. It's a big, big honour to win it! *Did you know?* Many amazing people from our own continent of Africa have won the Nobel Peace Prize! People like **Nelson Mandela** and **Archbishop Desmond Tutu** from South Africa won it. They taught us so much about forgiveness, kindness, and making peace. They are true heroes!

What Were Their Texts About?

So, here's what happened: Mr. Donald Trump and Mr. Jonas Gahr Store exchanged some text messages. In these messages, they were talking about Greenland. That sounds like an important topic for leaders, right? But something else came up in the texts. Mr. Store, the leader of Norway, said that Mr. Trump seemed very, very interested in the Nobel Peace Prize in these messages. It was like Mr. Trump was talking about the prize a lot, even when they were discussing other things. Mr. Store felt that when you are talking about serious things, like a big island like Greenland, it's better to focus on the serious topic itself, not just on prizes. It's like if you're helping your friend, you focus on helping them, not on getting a reward.

Why Did Mr. Store Speak Up?

Mr. Store felt it was important to share this because he believes that leaders should always talk about serious matters in a serious way. They should focus on what's best for people and countries, not just on who might win an award. He wanted to make sure everyone knows that working for peace and talking about important places like Greenland should be about helping people and solving problems, not about personal awards. It's all about what's important for everyone in the world.

What Can We Learn?

From this story, we can learn a few things. First, leaders talk to each other about big decisions. Second, it's good to focus on what's truly important. The Nobel Peace Prize is wonderful because it celebrates peace. But the *actual work* of making peace and helping people is the most important thing of all. We should always try to be peaceful, kind, and focus on helping others. That's the best prize anyone can get! Thank you for listening to our news from far away.

Until Next Time!

That's all for our news today, my young friends! Keep being curious and kind. See you next time for more exciting stories from around the world! Kwaheri!
summary: The leader of Norway, Mr. Jonas Gahr Store, said that America's former leader, Mr. Donald Trump, talked a lot about the important Nobel Peace Prize in text messages, even when they were discussing the big, icy island of Greenland.
whyMatters: This story is important because it shows us how big leaders talk to each other and what they think is important. It teaches us that when we talk about big things like countries or peace, we should focus on helping people and being serious, not just on awards or prizes.
